SEARCH
Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.example.platformerplain.entities

Class Entity

java.lang.Object
com.example.platformerplain.entities.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Coin, Decoration, Enemy, Goal, Ladder, Platform, Player, Spike
public abstract class Entity extends Object
Abstract class representing a game entity. This class serves as a base for all game entities, providing common properties and methods. Entities can have a visual representation (canvas) and a hitbox for collision detection.
Author:
Changyu Li

  • Method Details

    • isAnimated

      protected abstract boolean isAnimated()
      Checks if the entity is animated.
      Returns:
      true if the entity has animations; false otherwise.

    • canvas

      public javafx.scene.Node canvas()
      Returns the canvas associated with this entity.
      Returns:
      The canvas node used for rendering the entity.

    • hitBox

      public javafx.scene.Node hitBox()
      Returns the hitbox of the entity.
      Returns:
      The Node representing the hitbox for collision detection.

    • getType

      public abstract EntityType getType()
      Returns the type of the entity.
      Returns:
      The EntityType enumeration value representing the type of this entity.

    • update

      public abstract void update()
      Updates the entity's state. This method should be implemented to define how the entity behaves over time.

    • size

      public abstract int[] size()
      Returns the size of the entity.
      Returns:
      An array containing the width and height of the entity.
